comments: While creating Bugzilla Tasks on Eclipse.org (via Mylar 0.7) works well, in fact I created it like that, adding existing bugs fails.
Any (valid) task ID fails to be added with an Error: "Unable to retrieve task from repository."
Are you able to create queries in the tasklist against bugs.eclipse.org and open tasks?

Rob: I just tested, and if it's an ID that isn't in the task list I first get the "Bugzilla" editor tab stating that it can't be retrieved, then shortly after the automatic background synch it gets populated and all looks good.

Werner: do you see this message in the editor or as a dialog?

It's a dialog. And after that dialog dissapears the entry still does not show up.

I'm using Eclipse 3.2 (Callisto) with WTP 1.5 on Windows 2000. So I used the Eclipse 3.2 update
(if that should make a difference?)
Werner: please answer Rob's comment#2, he'll help you along from here.
This would be easy to diagnose if bug#159402 was fixed ;o)

Now that bug#159402 has been resolved, as Willian points out,  we should get more insight into why this is happening. We'll be putting a new dev build up tomorrow that you can try. I'll post here when it is available.

Update Site: download.eclipse.org/technology/mylar/update-site/dev
The dev build is now available (version 0.7.0.v20061013-1300).
Werner, have you had a chance to test with the latest dev build?

Is there an entry in Windows > Show View > Error Log corresponding to this error? If so, open it up and if there is a trace, please post it here. Once we track the source of this error I'll be sure to change the error message to be a bit more informative. ;)
Werner, did you get a chance to investigate?
It did not work with the latest version I tried ("Nightly Update Site")
Are you tunneling over ssh or using a proxy server?

Maybe some of those Error details (from the Eclipse Error View) may help?

This only occurs when an existing task is added (from Bugzilla/Eclipse.org)

We do have a Proxy, but at least from the outside, I'd assume this is always used the same way (and it works for creating new tasks, and other systems like JIRA)
Have you tried setting the proxy settings in Windows > Preferences > Install/Update > Proxy Settings to your proxy host. Perhaps that will resolved the unknown host error above?
0.9 is out now and uses a completely different library for http communication (which may have an affect on this issue). Let me know if you can reproduce with 0.9.

0.9 does not make a difference. Sorry!

It only throws a BugzillaException now instead of a more general java or Eclipse Network Exception.

Btw, there even seem new problems when synchronising EXISTING bugs, something that worked before 0.9 ?! (and not linked to this issue)

Do we have any more hits as to the source of this in the eclipse error log? 

What problems exactly are you finding with existing bug synchronization?
Please test using the latest mylar (rc1 ~ 9.1) since there have been more improvements in this regard.

(In reply to comment #24)
> Please test using the latest mylar (rc1 ~ 9.1) since there have been more
> improvements in this regard.

What is the update site for that? The original Update Site for Eclipse 3.2 does not work any more.

The Development version I tried for now (9.0.20061127) got installed, and works.

There is no more option to add existing Repository Tasks.
Is that on purpose?
It seems, the "Query" can now be used instead?

However, with the latest development version there are still problems accessing Bugzilla repositories through a proxy.

Here is the error message (I have removed the rest of the proxy's domain for privacy purposes, but the first 2 characters of "bristol" seem to be cut of by the plugin itself ?!

Connection Error, please ensure proper configuration in Task Repositories View.

  Error updating attributes.

istol-proxy2...

Adding new tasks is now achieved via the Open Repository Task dialog.  http://www.eclipse.org/mylar/doc/new.php Since this wasn't obvious you may want to post to the newsgroup/dev list suggesting it be added back to the menu.

What kind of proxy are you using? Currently only http proxy support has been tested.

Yes it does. Werner, I'll leave this report open until you can confirm. A dev build is available that includes the latest proxy improvements (0.9.1.v20061205-2030).

Seems, 1.0 solves it. At least I can now add/query existing bugs (including this one as just done in Mylar ;-)
